ARABIC: بِسْمِ ٱللَّهِ ٱلرَّحْمَٰنِ ٱلرَّحِيمِ تَبَّتْ يَدَآ أَبِى لَهَبٍ وَتَبَّ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: Ruin to the hands of Abu Lahab and ruin to him!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: DESTROYED WILL BE the hands of Abu Lahab, and he himself will perish.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: Destroyed were the hands of Abu Lahab, and he lay utterly doomed.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: May the hands of Abu Lahab perish!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: May both the hands of Abu Lahab be destroyed – and they are destroyed!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Perish the two hands of Abu Lahab and perish he!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Perdition overtake both hands of Abu Lahab, and he will perish.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: Perish the hands of Abu Lahab, and perish he!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: The power of Abu Lahab will perish, and he will perish.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: May the hands of Abu Lahab perish, may he be ruined.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Perish the two hands of Abu Lahab, and perish he!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: Perish the hands of Abu Lahab, and perish he!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Perish the hands of the Father of Flame! Perish he!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Perish the two hands of Abu Lahab (an uncle of the Prophet), and perish he!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: Perish the hands of AbiLahab, and perish he!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: Condemned are the hands of Abee Lahab, and he is condemned.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: May the hands of Abu Lahab be ruined, and ruined is he.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [111:1] Perish, ruined be, the hands of Abū Lahab, in other words, all of him — the use of ‘hands’ here to denote [all of] him is figurative, and is because most actions are performed by them; the statement is an invocation — and perish he!, may he be ruined! (this [tabba] is a predicate, as where one says, ahlakahu’Llāhu wa-qad halak, ‘God destroyed him and he indeed is destroyed’. When the Prophet threatened him with the chastisement, he said, ‘If what my brother’s son says is true, then I shall ransom [myself] from it with my wealth and sons!’; so the following was revealed:
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: And from his narration on the authority of Ibn 'Abbas that he said regarding the interpretation of Allah's saying (The power of Abu Lahab will perish): '(The power of Abu Lahab will perish) this is because when Allah said to His Prophet (pbuh) (And warn your tribe of near kindred [26: 214]) he called them and said: "Say: there is no god but Allah" and his uncle-the brother of his father from their mother's side-'Abd al-'Uzza whose agnomen was Abu Lahab said: "May you perish! Is this why you summoned us?" Allah then revealed His saying (The power of Abu Lahab will perish) He says: the hand of Abu Lahab is deprived of all good (and he will perish) he lost himself by rejecting belief in Allah's divine Oneness.
